fr: Partie de la route réservée aux véhicules, sans le trottoir.
en: Part of the road used by vehicles, not including the sidewalk.
tip: Questions often contrast chaussée and accotement.
example_fr: Je reste sur la chaussée, je ne monte pas sur le trottoir.
example_en: I stay on the roadway, I do not drive onto the sidewalk.

fr: Espace réservé aux piétons sur le côté de la route.
en: Space reserved for pedestrians on the side of the road.
tip: Driving or parking on a sidewalk is typically forbidden unless explicitly allowed.
example_fr: Je ne stationne pas sur le trottoir.
example_en: I do not park on the sidewalk.
example_tip: Look for markings or local signs.

fr: Croisement de deux routes ou plus.
en: Crossing of two or more roads.
example_fr: À l’intersection, je ralentis et j’observe.
example_en: At the intersection, I slow down and observe.
example_tip: Observation is a frequent grading point.

fr: Action de passer devant un autre véhicule en changeant de voie ou de position.
en: Passing another vehicle by changing lane or position.
tip: Often forbidden near intersections and with solid lines.
example_fr: Je ne dépasse pas près d’un passage piétons.
example_en: I do not overtake near a pedestrian crossing.
example_tip: Visibility and risk control drive the rule.

fr: Laisser passer un autre usager avant de s’engager.
en: Let another road user go first before entering.
tip: Used with STOP, Give Way, or priority to the right situations.
example_fr: Je cède le passage aux véhicules venant de droite.
example_en: I give way to vehicles coming from the right.
example_tip: Slow down early to show intent.
